content: Iamgonzo said it right - he should have had a jury of his PEERS judge him; rather, instruct the judge on what they recommend (juries do not convict people). We're out there in these places HONORABLY, and some criminal in a uniform is tainting our name. Had he been tried FAIRLY, his sentence would have likely been death. "Fairly" doesn't mean just making certain he doesn't face a guilty-before-proven-innocent panel. It also means that he should be judged by a group who are similar to him. Too many people forget that little fact. What would have been true "fairness" is for the military to have rendered his verdict AND sentenced him. 12 civilians in KY know nothing about war, the military, or what transpired. But his command structure does and did. Military knows military. This life in prison stinks to high heaven. Let's look at some facts. It costs... $70k a year to put a man away for life when one accounts for all the associated costs? He'll live... what? Another 50-ish years? A .45 round costs 32 cents. Why are OUR tax dollars being abused to put this man -- I use that term ONLY in its most generic sense -- away for life when 32 cents will accomplish the same thing? Why not take all that saved money and better fund the military needs for mental health care so that incidents like this are cut off before they even happen? This moral superiority of professed narcissism that is life in prison instead of instant death is nonsensical, wasteful, and costly. Guess what? You're still killing him! You're just prolonging his own suffering and agony, as well as burdening taxpayers. You lock a man in a cage like an animal and he'll become... an animal. He's just as dead. Now he's just dying for your sick sense of retribution. That ain't justice. That's just twisted and perverted. A sentence of more than 20 years should be a bullet to the brain pan. Period. And before you scoffers lay into me about DNA and the few true innocents that have been falsely imprisoned - don't. Do you have any clue at all what it is like to be jailed for a crime you never committed? Well, I do. I'd prefer death. And so would you if they were going to lock you, an innocent, up for 20+ years. Just get it over, don't make me suffer for something I owe no penance to, and let me go meet my maker. 20-year sentence = instant and public execution. Stop locking up people for simple possession crimes. Stop making stupid laws that MAKE otherwise innocent people criminals. Get the church out of the justice system. We'd pay off our deficit in 2 years. Victims would have justice, and swiftly. Innocents wouldn't suffer false incarceration. Would-be criminals would think twice if they saw just ONE public shooting. Gang violence in jails would drop dramatically. America is thinking with her heart and not with her head. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
